intro: Osteomeles personii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture. Osteomeles personii is often found growing in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along stream banks.
